Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as c76c5586b85737bb20ec385826a3c2007e42a9ea
Adding "leading -" helps to continue the service incase any failure in update_admin_account.sh execution.
added new service file under meta-ibm to this script
Done
Done

You should also update the obmc-phosphor-image.bbappend

Do you need to modify this for the service user also?
No, this fix is not needed for the service user because the special IBM service user has a regular home directory and the service user cannot be deleted

obmc-phosphor-image.bbappend still needs to be fixed so that you don't end up with this problem in the future.  Running a fix-up script, like this "update_admin_account" should be a limited time operation.

I agree.  The community version of the bad code is here https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-ibm/recipes-phosphor/images/obmc-phosphor-image.bbappend
And I think the fix is to remove the `-M` and the `-d /` arguments from the `useradd ... admin` command.
We should add that to this commit (and test again from a factory-clean image).

I have marked service Type to oneshot
[Service]
ExecStart={bindir}/update_admin_account.sh
Type=oneshot
it works as expected, is it not enough?
understand your point, addressed your comments
